chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
n: nat
v: Vector.t nat m
i: nat

Goal:
~ divides (ps n) (exp i v)

Premises:
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
exp = fix exp (n i : nat) (v : vec nat n) {struct v} : nat := match v with | vec_nil => 1 | Vector.cons _ x n0 v0 => qs i ^ x * exp n0 (S i) v0 end : forall n : nat, nat -> vec nat n -> nat Arguments exp {n}%nat_scope _%nat_scope
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
ps = {| str := fun n : nat => nthprime (2 * n); str_inj := fun (n m : nat) (H : nthprime (2 * n) = nthprime (2 * m)) => let H0 : 2 * n = 2 * m := nthprime_inj (2 * n) (2 * m) H in (fun lemma : n = m <-> BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (n = m) (BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat BinNums.Z eq BinInt.Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) n (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) eq_refl m (BinInt.Z.of_nat m) eq
ps_qs_div : forall n m : nat, ~ divides (ps n) (qs m)
qs_ps_div : forall n m : nat, ~ divides (qs n) (ps m)
primestream_divides : forall (ps : primestream) (n m : nat), divides (ps n) (ps m) -> n = m
power_factor_uniq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> ~ divides p x -> ~ divides p y -> p ^ i * x = p ^ j * y -> i = j /\ x = y
exp_cons : forall (n i x : nat) (v : vec nat n), exp i (x ## v) = qs i ^ x * exp (S i) v
binomial.divides_fact : forall n i : nat, 0 < i <= n -> divides i (binomial.fact n)
power_factor_lt_neq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> i < j -> ~ divides p x -> p ^ i * x <> p ^ j * y
exp_app : forall (n m i : nat) (v : vec nat n) (w : vec nat m), exp i (vec_app v w) = exp i v * exp (n + i) w
divides_bool_spec' : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = false < -> ~ divides (S n) p
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
vec_plus_cons : forall (n x : nat) (v : vec nat n) (y : nat) (w : vec nat n), vec_plus (x ## v) (y ## w) = x + y ## vec_plus v w
exp_nil : forall i : nat, exp i vec_nil = 1
exp_zero : forall n i : nat, exp i vec_zero = 1
vec_plus_assoc : forall (n : nat) (u v w : vec nat n), vec_plus u (vec_plus v w) = vec_plus (vec_plus u v) w
ZifyClasses.not_morph : forall s1 t1 : Prop, s1 < -> t1 -> ~ s1 < -> ~ t1
vec_app_cons : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (x : X) (v : vec X n) (w : vec X m), vec_app (x ## v) w = x ## vec_app v w
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat m : nat v : vec nat m i : nat |- nat]
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
divides_bool_spec : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = true < -> divides (S n) p
prime_bool_rec_spec : forall n p : nat, n <= p -> prime_bool_rec n p = true < -> (forall k : nat, 3 <= n - 2 * k -> ~ divides (n - 2 * k) p)
binomial.divides_fact_S : forall n : nat, divides (binomial.fact n) (binomial.fact (S n))
binomial.divides_n_fact_n : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> divides n (binomial.fact n)
not_prime_1 = fun H : prime 1 => match H with | conj H0 x => match H0 eq_refl return ((forall q : nat, divides q 1 -> q = 1 \/ q = 1) -> False) with end x end : ~ prime 1
modS_divide : forall n p : nat, p mod S n = 0 < -> divides (S n) p
vec_change_pred : forall (n : nat) (v : vec nat n) (p : pos n) (u : nat), v#>p = S u -> v = vec_plus (vec_one p) (v[u/p])
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ divides p n}
vec_plus = fun (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) => vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => (v#>p) + (w#>p)) : forall n : nat, vec nat n -> vec nat n -> vec nat n Arguments vec_plus {n}%nat_scope
divides_dec : forall q p : nat, {k : nat | q = k * p} + {~ divides p q}
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope

```coq
Lemma ps_not_divides_exp_i_v : ~ divides (ps n) (exp i v).
Proof.
induction i.
* simpl. apply ps_qs_div.
* rewrite exp_cons. apply IHi. apply ps_qs_div.
Qed.
